definition: to drill or bore a hole/to attract attention/conspicuous
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: Drilling and blasting is the most widely used method of rock breaking at present.
sentences.chinese: 打眼放炮是目前应用最广泛的破岩方法。

sentences.english: Yellow and blue was in evidence.
Special guide sleeves are used to obtain greater precision in drilling .
sentences.chinese: 使用特制导向套管来保证较高的打眼精度。

sentences.english: You'll have to drill for each of the bolts.
She is a knockout in that red dress.
sentences.chinese: 她穿那套红色的连衣裙很打眼。

sentences.english: Certain types of steel don't bore well .
sentences.chinese: 有些品种的钢材不容易打眼。

definition: to appear before one's eyes/pleasing to the eye/nice to look at
to dazzle/to blink at/to open one's eyes wide
see 灰不溜丟|灰不溜丢[hui1 bu5 liu1 diu1]
